column4: Need Help: My OS (Jaunty) Update Manager  is telling that I don't have any more free space however I've cleaned out at least 1 Gig and a half.  Still get the message.
try: sudo apt-get clean
SAME ERROR MSG
can you provide a pastebin of the output of   df -h
working on it.
Taking a while!
Becauwse my drive is full firefox won't even let me submit the df -h out into the browser.
do it the easy way: sudo apt-get install pastebinit; df -h | pastebinit
Can't install.
try running firefox -safemode   then clear out the cache
http://pastebin.com/f569a334a
It returned THAT.
ok your / partition is 100% full, not good
run:    dpkg -l | less
But I've deleted a GOOD BIT OF STUFF.
then uninstall unneeded apps, like gimp if you never use it, or open office can be removed and install abiword
dpkg -l | less DONE.
read the list, uninstall crap you dont need. Default installs are FULL of the stuff
ok.  But why would it tell my it's full when I've deleted like old Movies andd stuff?
try a reboot maybe, its stil full apparently
I dod reboot several times after cleaning out stuff.
try Mark Rijckenberg's advice here: https://answers.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/update-manager/+question/80347
could help
